Package org.anchoranalysis.core.functional

Class OptionalUtilities

Object
OptionalUtilities
public class OptionalUtilities
extends Object
Additional utility functions for Optional and exceptions.
Author:
Owen Feehan

  • Method Summary

    Creates an Optional from a boolean flag - where the supplier can thrown an exception
    static <T> Optional<T> createFromFlagOptional​(boolean flag, java.util.function.Supplier<Optional<T>> valueIfFlagTrue)
    Creates an Optional from a boolean flag and a supplier that returns an Optional

    Optional<T>    		 flatMap​(Optional<S> optional, CheckedFunction<S,​Optional<T>,​E> mapFunction)
    Like Optional.flatMap(java.util.function.Function<? super T, ? extends java.util.Optional<? extends U>>) but tolerates an exception in the mapping function, which is immediately thrown.

  • Method Details

    • ifPresent

      public static <S,​ E extends Exception> void ifPresent​(Optional<S> optional, CheckedConsumer<S,​E> consumerFunction) throws E extends Exception
      Like Optional.map(java.util.function.Function<? super T, ? extends U>) but tolerates an exception in the mapping function, which is immediately thrown.
      Type Parameters:
      S - optional-type
      E - exception that may be thrown during mapping
      Parameters:
      optional - incoming optional
      consumerFunction - the function that is called if an optional contains a vlaue
      Throws:
      E - an exception if consumerFunction throws it
      E extends Exception

    • map

      public static <S,​ T,​ E extends Exception> Optional<T> map​(Optional<S> optional, CheckedFunction<S,​T,​E> mapFunction) throws E extends Exception
      Like Optional.map(java.util.function.Function<? super T, ? extends U>) but tolerates an exception in the mapping function, which is immediately thrown.
      Type Parameters:
      S - incoming optional-type for map
      T - outgoing optional-type for map
      E - exception that may be thrown during mapping
      Parameters:
      optional - incoming optional
      mapFunction - the function that does the mapping from incoming to outgoing
      Returns:
      the outgoing "mapped" optional
      Throws:
      E - an exception if the mapping function throws it
      E extends Exception

    • orElseGet

      public static <T,​ E extends Exception> T orElseGet​(Optional<T> optional, CheckedSupplier<T,​E> supplier) throws E extends Exception
      Like Optional.orElseGet(java.util.function.Supplier<? extends T>) but tolerates an exception in the supplier function, which is immediately thrown.
      Type Parameters:
      T - optional-type
      E - exception that may be thrown during mapping
      Parameters:
      optional - incoming optional
      supplier - supplies a value if the optional is empty
      Returns:
      the outgoing optional
      Throws:
      E - an exception if the supplier throws it
      E extends Exception

    • flatMap

      public static <S,​ T,​ E extends Exception> Optional<T> flatMap​(Optional<S> optional, CheckedFunction<S,​Optional<T>,​E> mapFunction) throws E extends Exception
      Like Optional.flatMap(java.util.function.Function<? super T, ? extends java.util.Optional<? extends U>>) but tolerates an exception in the mapping function, which is immediately thrown.
      Type Parameters:
      S - incoming optional-type for map
      T - outgoing optional-type for map
      E - exception that may be thrown during mapping
      Parameters:
      optional - incoming optional
      mapFunction - the function that does the mapping from incoming to outgoing
      Returns:
      the outgoing "mapped" optional
      Throws:
      E - an exception if the mapping function throws it
      E extends Exception

    • mapBoth

      public static <T,​ U,​ V,​ E extends Exception> Optional<T> mapBoth​(Optional<U> optional1, Optional<V> optional2, CheckedBiFunction<U,​V,​T,​E> mapFunction) throws E extends Exception
      Mapping only occurs if both Optionals are non-empty (equivalent to a logical AND on the optionals)
      Type Parameters:
      T - outgoing optional-type for map
      U - first incoming optional-type for map
      V - second incoming optional-type for map
      Parameters:
      optional1 - first incoming optional
      optional2 - second incoming optional
      mapFunction - the function that does the mapping from both incoming objects to outgoing
      Returns:
      the outgoing "mapped" optional (empty() if either incoming optional is empty)
      Throws:
      E extends Exception

    • orFlat

      @SafeVarargs public static <T> Optional<T> orFlat​(Optional<T>... optionals)
      The first optional if it's present, or the second, or the third etc. using an array
      Type Parameters:
      T - type of optionals
      Returns:
      a new optional that is optionals[0] OR optionals[1] OR optionals[2] etc.

    • create

      public static Optional<String> create​(String possiblyEmptyString)
      Creates an Optional from a string that might be empty or null
      Parameters:
      possiblyEmptyString - a string that might be empty or null
      Returns:
      the string, or empty() if the string is empty or null

    • createFromFlag

      public static <T> Optional<T> createFromFlag​(boolean flag, T valueIfFlagTrue)
      Creates an Optional from a boolean flag
      Type Parameters:
      T - type in Optional
      Parameters:
      flag - iff true an populated optional is returned, otherwise empty().
      valueIfFlagTrue - a positive value to use if fla gis true
      Returns:
      a filled or empty optional depending on flag

    • createFromFlag

      public static <T> Optional<T> createFromFlag​(boolean flag, java.util.function.Supplier<T> valueIfFlagTrue)
      Creates an Optional from a boolean flag
      Type Parameters:
      T - type in Optional
      Parameters:
      flag - iff true an populated optional is returned, otherwise empty().
      valueIfFlagTrue - used to generate a positive value
      Returns:
      a filled or empty optional depending on flag

    • createFromFlagChecked

      public static <T,​ E extends Exception> Optional<T> createFromFlagChecked​(boolean flag, CheckedSupplier<T,​E> valueIfFlagTrue) throws E extends Exception
      Creates an Optional from a boolean flag - where the supplier can thrown an exception
      Type Parameters:
      T - type in Optional
      Parameters:
      flag - iff true an populated optional is returned, otherwise empty().
      valueIfFlagTrue - used to generate a positive value
      Returns:
      a filled or empty optional depending on flag
      Throws:
      E - if the supplioer throws an exception
      E extends Exception

    • createFromFlagOptional

      public static <T> Optional<T> createFromFlagOptional​(boolean flag, java.util.function.Supplier<Optional<T>> valueIfFlagTrue)
      Creates an Optional from a boolean flag and a supplier that returns an Optional
      Type Parameters:
      T - type in Optional
      Parameters:
      flag - iff true an populated optional is returned, otherwise empty().
      valueIfFlagTrue - used to generate a positive value
      Returns:
      a filled or empty optional depending on flag
